commit_message:
Switch to use stestr

This switches to use stestr instead of testrepository, and added
openstack--cover-jobs to .zuul.yaml to separate the normal unit test
task.

Change-Id: I633acb0d6e38fa6f4d9c360d5a8eb6f7859a3ae1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cliff refs/changes/45/721545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: whitelist_externals = * stestr run {posargs}[testenv:cover] setenv = {[testenv]setenv} PYTHON=coverage run --source cliff --parallel-mode commands = stestr run {posargs} coverage combine coverage html -d cover coverage xml -o cover/coverage.xml coverage report --show-missing

commit_message:
Move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt

Put these in place as a setup for the new versions of the doc build
jobs. Keep using them from the normal dep list until the jobs are
changed.

While we're here, update the docs env to use sphinx-build instead of
python setup.py build_sphinx. Also add python2.7 to the docs env, since
I accidentally tried building it with my python3 tox and it blew up
substantially.

Conflicts:
	setup.cfg

Modifications:
	cliff/app.py

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflicts are due to us backporting this patch before
I0f94a431be083b8b4baec850b1885ba07b5bf5c2. We're doing this since this
patch basically overrides what I0f94a431be083b8b4baec850b1885ba07b5bf5c2
did. Note that we also exclude '[venv] deps' since we don't need docs
dependencies in this anymore. The modifications are to appease flake8,
which is unpinned here.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/658121
Change-Id: I0fcc50c4c396758e839c329ce786a6f609bb1342
(cherry picked from commit 2f687e3373a471cbf66903af736f13b58eb4ee82)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cliff refs/changes/44/657844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE.

Change-Id: I4807e406cf6238767ceb02590c713f738686fa1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-dashboard refs/changes/45/733645/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I8adfadd54749890e83a3a3048ad70a16428857d7

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox and stop use pip.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value. Use the
right way when it's necessary.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695022/
Change-Id: I2f18df5d26847b6545af99e969ebbe04d3326e30

commit_message:
Remove ValidateNtp

We already do this in the time configuration and it is no longer a
configurable item due to containers. Let's stop doing this in the all
nodes validation and let the time configuration handle the failure
messaging.

Change-Id: Ib0abcbd25117ecd587f4a92698746e5e256e6e8e
(cherry picked from commit ed2df1a05f7a19de798fe2a1b5e2a625b261c551)

commit_message:
Fix unit test for ovsdbapp indexing

Just need to mock out autocreate_indices to pass

Change-Id: Ifb4aa058dad892892db6b708ad7d60804bfb5590

commit_message:
Make volume mount path configurable for ContainerShareDriver

 Mount volumes to /tmp/ on host is not suitable for some environments
 wheen operatpr wants for specify such path for any reason.

Change-Id: Ibbdd755721de3727bf779852be039ea5639310bc

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/3.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/3.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ice034bb721981d029d2e131a9053e34695376e23

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I01e577ce32814268381ed825fdb30c2d5a0980e9

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I4c7cb63e0a816b361c2544b1be34d8a6dadeb5c0

commit_message:
ovn-dbs-bundle: Prepare for supporting new OVN version with separarte run dirs

This patch prepares the ground for using the latest OVN. OVN is split from
openvswitch and it has its own code repo. After the split, OVN has its
own run dir (/var/run/ovn), db dir (/etc/ovn/), log dir (/var/logs/ovn)
and datadir - /usr/share/ovn/scripts.

With this patch, it supports running older version (2.11) or new
version (2.12) without any issues. It mounts the host directories accordingly
so that there is no impact when OVN is updated.

Change-Id: I5d778cbeb2863ec0fe649799863752e8eb16492f
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove configs and entries for deprecated registry

Including removal of the example conf in docs.
Including glance-registry command entrypoint to eventlet.
Including rpc_controller from wsgi, changed to reject.
Not including the files devstack is depending on.

This change means that glance-registry starts and announces
that it has been removed.
This change means that when ran as wsgi app, all calls to
/rpc endpoint will be rejected.

This will allow devstack to make a graceful transition to
life without the glance registry, which was deprecated in
Newton release.

Change-Id: I7bf3284cba4c38605fb50b3c458e53f896f34086

commit_message:
Fix gate job failures and py3 compatibility

- Fix incorrect type handling of secret payload in py3
  (it should be bytes instead of str by default)
- Fix py3 compatibility of test codes
- Update expiration date so that resources are created with valid
  expiration.

Change-Id: I4935f601f87e9c49499da1034a320eee2e655b4d
(cherry picked from commit 6420da336083d936da9a4563149b08d785d70c84)

commit_message:
Amend the in-band deploy steps spec

The current spec leaves a too narrow priority space for custom
in-band steps, while leaving 70 numbers after the final instance
is booted, which is arguably not help. Spread the proposed steps
evenly between 100 and 20, leaving 3 blocks with 19 priorities
each for customization.

Also rename "remove_provisioning_network" since removing the network
is not the only thing it does.

Change-Id: I9861f4a8878789e2ae68e8e69c4e5660e33f4989
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/39/734039/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. ``write_image`` [80]:#. ``prepare_instance_boot`` [60]: #. install bootloader (if needed) #. configure the boot interface #. ``tear_down_agent`` [40]:#. ``boot_instance`` [20]:The useful priority ranges for inserting custom in-band steps are: * 99 to 81: preparation before writing the image (e.g. software RAID). * 79 to 61: modifications to the image before a bootloader is written (e.g. GRUB defaults changes). * 59 to 41: modifications to the final instance (e.g. software configuration). *Priority: 80*For the ``direct`` interface, this step will start as an out-of-band one, will collect the necessary information, then switch into being executed in-band by IPA. It will be equivalent to executing the existing ``standby.prepare_image`` command via the agent API, and will block until the image has been written. This allows us to remove this special case of command status polling. There will need to be a transition period to support old IPA ramdisks that do not support in-band deploy steps.*Priority: 60*tear_down_agent ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ *Priority: 40**Priority: 20*
deleted_lines: #. ``write_image`` [90]:#. ``prepare_instance_boot`` [80]: #. prepare instance to boot #. ``remove_provisioning_network`` [75]:#. ``boot_instance`` [70]:*Priority: 90*For the ``direct`` interface, this step will be executed in-band by IPA. It will be equivalent to executing the existing ``standby.prepare_image`` command via the agent API, and will block until the image has been written. This allows us to remove this special case of command status polling. There will need to be a transition period to support old IPA ramdisks that do not support in-band deploy steps. This will be inserted as an optional out-of-band deploy step when necessary (based on the IPA API version).*Priority: 80*remove_provisioning_network ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ *Priority: 75**Priority: 70*

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-barbicanclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Id55914141099650752027aa9dc0ad8a90528a2e9

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iec58d8dfa90b9b3d7b67d81798b32fb2670e21d4

commit_message:
Cleanup repo

* Remove unused files babel.cfg and openstack-common.conf.
* Remove obsolete entries from setup.cfg.
* Remove six as requirement
* Switch to newer hacking version and fix all problems.
* Remove Babel requirement, update requirements for python3

Change-Id: I1fc46288e54a5b787afbd9ee31b32a0e7d28c6de

Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

commit_message:
Option to aggregate containers manage debug stats

Add ContainerManageStatsDebug param, Default: false.
Enabling it allows aggregating debug info/stats for containers
management tasks.

Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Add tripleo_container_manage_stats to trace containers

for containers management. Defaul: false.

commit_message:
Add --trace flag for extra debug information

Allow 'openstack tripleo deploy' to be used in the tracing mode.
Currently this enables t-h-t ContainerManageStatsDebug flag to
aggregate containers management debug stats during deploy.

Other tracing addons may be controled by this flag as well.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/734441
Change-Id: Id35a7fbfa2c2538aaa80f3b0cbb8a8b657b7ee5e
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/82/734482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('time.time', return_value=123) @mock.patch('yaml.safe_load', return_value={}, autospec=True) @mock.patch('yaml.safe_dump', autospec=True) @mock.patch('os.path.isfile', return_value=True) @mock.patch('six.moves.builtins.open') @mock.patch('tripleoclient.v1.tripleo_deploy.Deploy.' '_process_hieradata_overrides', autospec=True) @mock.patch('tripleoclient.v1.tripleo_deploy.Deploy.' '_update_passwords_env', autospec=True) @mock.patch('tripleoclient.v1.tripleo_deploy.Deploy.' '_normalize_user_templates', return_value=[], autospec=True) @mock.patch('tripleoclient.utils.rel_or_abs_path', return_value={}, autospec=True) @mock.patch('tripleoclient.utils.run_command_and_log', return_value=0, autospec=True) def test_setup_heat_environments_trace_plugins( self, mock_run, mock_paths, mock_norm, mock_update_pass_env, mock_process_hiera, mock_open, mock_os, mock_yaml_dump, mock_yaml_load, mock_time): parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, ['--local-ip', '127.0.0.1/8', '--templates', 'tht_from', '--trace', '--output-dir', 'tht_to'], []) plugin = 'tht_from/trace-plugins.yaml' self.cmd.output_dir = 'tht_to' self.cmd.tht_render = 'tht_from' environment = self.cmd._setup_heat_environments( parsed_args.roles_file, parsed_args.networks_file, parsed_args) self.assertIn(plugin, environment) mock_open.assert_has_calls([mock.call(plugin, 'w')]) # unpack the dump yaml calls to verify if the produced stack update # plugin matches our expectations found_plugin = False print('XXX %s' % mock_yaml_dump.call_args_list) for call in mock_yaml_dump.call_args_list: args, kwargs = call for a in args: if isinstance(a, mock.mock.MagicMock): continue tracer = a.get('parameter_defaults', {}).get( 'ContainerManageStatsDebug', None) if tracer: self.assertTrue(tracer) found_plugin = True self.assertTrue(found_plugin)

commit_message:
Option to process stats for containers managment

For standalone jobs, if stats collection is enabled, post-process the
file containing the collected stats. Controled by
standalone_tripleo_container_manage_stats (defaults to false).
Enable it on a CI job-by-case basis.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/734078
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/734483

Change-Id: I89da37ae832149069fa538aa6f59288a8662a4a4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/78/731578/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tripleo_deploy_home_dir: "{{ working_dir }}" - name: Extract containers management basic stats from the standalone deployment log failed_when: false no_log: no register: custom_stats shell: >- cat {{ working_dir }}/ansible.log | awk -F '"containers_manage_data\": ' '{if ($2) print "{\"containers_manage_data\":"$2}' | jq --slurp ".[].containers_manage_data[] | \"$CID $ORDER $STATE $STATUS $RC $RST $NAME $ACT $CMD\"" | sort -k1 -k2 environment: CID: >- config_id=\(if (.Labels.config_id == null and .action == null) then "externally_managed" else .Labels.config_id end) ORDER: start_order=\(if (.start_order == null) then 0 else .start_order end) STATE: StateIdentifiedAs=\(.StateIdentifiedAs) STATUS: Status=\(.Status) RC: \(if .ExitCode != 0 then .ExitCode else "" end) RST: \(if (.restart != null) then .restart else "" end) NAME: Name=\(if (.Labels.container_name != null) then .Labels.container_name else .Labels.name end) ACT: \(if (.action != null) then .action else "" end) CMD: \(if (.action != null) then .command else "" end) - name: Print containers management basic stats debug: var: custom_stats.stdout_lines when: len(custom_stats.stdout_lines) > 0

commit_message:
Persist collected container management stats

when tripleo_container_manage_stats is set, also
dump the collected containers management stats into
tripleo_container_manage_log_path/containers_management_data.json

Change-Id: I8df8e7568f6a4122ff1caf9143875f24f64d781d
Related-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/78/734078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: notify: Persist containers management data stats

subject: Aggregate data for podman-managed containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-19 13:43:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/cf8fb1969b413d72ce28fac4b85a74d6efb1f7e5', 'message': 'Aggregate stats for podman-managed containers

Use aggregating capabilities of get_stats to allow users to track
containers management configs and its known runtime states by the
end of deployment.

Ansible tracks the following data (by merging it on the per hosts
basis):

* input containers configs passed in with json files,
* collected from podman 'State' infos for the changed or failed
  containers and ones that required rc checks.

When executed with ANSIBLE_SHOW_CUSTOM_STATS=true or show_custom_stats
set in ansible.cfg, the given stats may be useful for users wishing
to debug issues or to build a visual representation for the managed
containers, like dependency and state graphs.

Stats may be consumed either directly from json callback or from the
produced ansible log/stdout, like that:

... skipped ansible outputs ...
CUSTOM STATS:
foo: { "one_stat": {  "11": {   "22": {    "33": 44   }  } }}

And for which after stripping off the host info ('foo: ') part,
json.loads() gives: {'one_stat': {'11': {'22': {'33': 44}}}}.

Change-Id: I453d6d5024fd9385ad7fe3d95e7f20b92097bb7f
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2020-05-20 11:01:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/10b5f85f289bf464a173f9353f28e925233a284b', 'message': 'Aggregate stats for podman-managed containers

Use aggregating capabilities of get_stats to allow users to track
containers management configs and its known runtime states by the
end of deployment.

Ansible tracks the following data (by merging it on the per hosts
basis):

* input containers configs passed in with json files,
* collected from podman 'State' and 'Config' infos for the changed or
  failed containers and ones that required rc checks,
* the state identified by internal logic that analyzes runtime states.

The latter is tracked in StateIdentifiedAs, that accepts values:
'changed', 'failed', 'broken', 'did not exit' and 'unknown' as the
following:

* those that idientified as changed or failed will be assigned the
  corresponding state in theirs StateIdentifiedAs;
* those that identified as required rc check will be expanded into
  either 'broken' or 'did not exit' by the rc check completion;
* those that got input configs but have had no runtime state matched,
  are likely ones that missed their expected container management
  actions and will end up having the 'unknown' state;
* the initial value for StateIdentifiedAs is unknown and is set before
  any actions are taken.

When executed with ANSIBLE_SHOW_CUSTOM_STATS=true or show_custom_stats
set in ansible.cfg, the given stats may be useful for users wishing
to debug issues or to build a visual representation for the managed
containers, like dependency and state graphs.

Stats may be consumed either directly from json callback or from the
produced ansible log/stdout, like that:

... skipped ansible outputs ...
CUSTOM STATS:
foo: { "one_stat": {  "11": {   "22": {    "33": 44   }  } }}

And for which after stripping off the host info ('foo: ') part,
json.loads() gives: {'one_stat': {'11': {'22': {'33': 44}}}}.

Change-Id: I453d6d5024fd9385ad7fe3d95e7f20b92097bb7f
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

* those that idientified as changed or failed will be assigned the

"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2020-06-03 15:04:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/9baf89a209dcd6c8e0a5ffcb1c1314804bf5cb11', 'message': "Aggregate data for podman-managed containers

Merge batched containers' config, run-time and internal state tracking
data to allow users to debug or visualize containers management
process. By the end of deployment it is stored into a cached fact
(containers_manage_data) so that it can be used externally until
expired.

Note: this technically may be as well achieved with get_stats.
Howewer, there may be issues when such stats are not or cannot be
displayed for reasons.

This feature is controled by tripleo_container_manage_stats and
is turned off by default. It may be enabled for a particular
CI jobs or manual debugging sessions. If it shows no performance
issues in future we can turn it on by default.

Ansible tracks the following data (by merging it on the per hosts
basis):

* input containers configs passed in with json files,
* collected from podman '.State' and '.Config.Labels' infos for the
  changed or failed containers and ones that required rc checks,
* the state identified by internal logic that analyzes runtime states
  such as failed or changed.

The latter is tracked in StateIdentifiedAs, that accepts values:
'changed', 'failed', 'to check', 'broken', 'did not exit' and 'unknown'
as the following:

* those that idientified as changed or failed or needs to be checked,
  will be assigned the corresponding state in theirs StateIdentifiedAs;
* those that identified as required rc check will be expanded into
  either 'broken' or 'did not exit' by the rc check completion;
* those that got input configs but have had no runtime state matched,
  are likely ones that missed their expected container management
  actions and will end up having the initial 'unknown' state;
* the initial value for StateIdentifiedAs is unknown and is set before
  any actions are taken.

That data may be useful for users wishing to debug issues or to build a
visual representation for the managed containers, like dependency and
state graphs.

Change-Id: I453d6d5024fd9385ad7fe3d95e7f20b92097bb7f
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2020-06-03 17:06:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/c6c3310ce5e91d51cec5c5a6492dd324550f10f3', 'message': "Aggregate data for podman-managed containers

"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2020-06-04 16:13:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/84cc906de9b94b813d496ffbccb789f97f83cf20', 'message': "Aggregate data for podman-managed containers

Merge batched containers' config, run-time and internal state tracking
data to allow users to debug or visualize containers management
process. By the end of deployment it is stored into a cached fact
(containers_manage_data) so that it can be used externally until
expired.

Note: this technically may be as well achieved with get_stats.
Howewer, there may be issues when such stats are not or cannot be
displayed for reasons.

This feature is controled by tripleo_container_manage_stats and
is turned off by default. It may be enabled for a particular
CI jobs or manual debugging sessions. If it shows no performance
issues in future we can turn it on by default.

Ansible tracks the following data (by merging it on the per hosts
basis):

* input containers configs passed in with json files,
* collected from podman '.State' and '.Config' infos for the
  changed or failed containers and ones that required rc checks,
* the state transitions identified by internal logic that analyzes
  runtime states such as failed or changed.

The latter is tracked in StateIdentifiedAs, that accepts a list of
the state transition values, such as:
'changed', 'failed', 'toCheck', 'broken', 'didNotExit', 'OK' and 'null'
as the following:

* those that idientified as failed or changed and needs to be checked,
  will be assigned the corresponding state in theirs StateIdentifiedAs;
* those that identified as required rc check will be expanded into
  either broken or did not exit, or finished OK;
* those that got input configs but have had no runtime state matched,
  nor had they been identified by the state machine checker as having
  any of the known/expected states, will end up having the 'null' state
  meaning there was no state transitions for such containers at all.

That data may be useful for users wishing to debug issues or to build a
visual representation for the managed containers, like dependency and
state graphs.

Change-Id: I453d6d5024fd9385ad7fe3d95e7f20b92097bb7f
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Aggregate data for podman-managed containers

Merge batched containers configs, run-time and internal state tracking
data to allow users to debug or visualize containers management
process. By the end of deployment it is stored into a cached fact
(containers_manage_data) so that it can be used externally until
expired.

Also complete the list of possible and unexpected transitions of
containers tracked with the internal state machine:
* track containers to be checked for exit codes as an intermediate
  transition that must be expanded into the one of the other expeted
  end states.
* also track to-be-checked containers exited normally (exit code is in
  tripleo_container_manage_valid_exit_code)
* track changed containers that are expected to remain running after
  that (ones with the restart policy defined),
* track unknown and unrecognized types of containers, like those that
  was not changed this time and remain running from the previous
  deployments; or that have unrecognized state this time because of a
  bug perhaps.

Note: this technically may be as well achieved with get_stats.
Howewer, there may be issues when such stats are not or cannot be
displayed for reasons.

This feature is controled by tripleo_container_manage_stats and
is turned off by default. It may be enabled for a particular
CI jobs or manual debugging sessions. If it shows no performance
issues in future we can turn it on by default.

Ansible tracks the following data (by merging it on the per hosts
basis):

* input containers configs passed in with json files,
* collected from podman '.State' and '.Config' infos for the
  changed or failed containers and ones that required rc checks,
* the state transitions identified by internal logic that analyzes
  runtime states such as failed or changed.

The latter is tracked in StateIdentifiedAs, that accepts a list of
the state transitions, such as:
* ('failed', 'running') - the end state with no further transitions,
  running means 'running after changed';
* 'changed' - intermediate state, always needs to be checked for
  results or marked as 'running' otherwise;
* 'toCheck' - can only follow 'changed' and must be expanded into
  either of ('broken', 'didNotExit', 'OK') end states;
* 'unknown' and null - indicates containers not involved in any
  transitions.

Those state transitions are getting assigned to the intnernally tracked
containers managed in batches as the following:
* those that idientified as failed or changed and running, considered
  reached its end state and will get the corresponding state markers;
* those that changed but need further checking, will be added an
  intermediate toCheck state transition;
* those that identified as required rc check will be expanded into
  either broken, did not exit or finished OK end states;
* those identified as belonging to the batch but found in an unexpected
  state, will have the unknown mark (see the StartedAt timestamps);
* unchanged containers that remain running since the previous
  deployment executions also fall into 'unknown' category (howewer,
  those will have timestamp from before the deployment started);
* other ones will end up having the null state. That may be containers
  managed externally, like by pacemaker. Or having non-matching config
  IDs. Or whatever reason that made them not identified by the state
  machine checker. That state also means that there was no state
  transitions for such containers at all.

Example in-directly unexpected state transitions that might point to
issues or bugs:
* changed or toCheck is in the end of the transition for a container,
* running, failed, or any other end state is followed by another
  state transition,

That data may be useful for users wishing to debug issues or to build a
visual representation for the managed containers, like dependency and
state graphs.

Change-Id: I453d6d5024fd9385ad7fe3d95e7f20b92097bb7f
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-03 19:10:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/reviewstats/commit/4be7831173fd84637d67048a6ff6ab438deefd06', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I33db298dd24f1e9795fb789f7c6964a97ba0651f
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I33db298dd24f1e9795fb789f7c6964a97ba0651f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reviewstats refs/changes/69/733369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I3b728aee2f07ad547ee75cabf78659cef1233bc5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-barbicanclient refs/changes/75/720975/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I71a09f2eddd3a344225cb69f9679e99fdeb3e2db
"}]
commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I71a09f2eddd3a344225cb69f9679e99fdeb3e2db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/46/734346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running,
  remove babel.cfg.
- remove obsolete file openstack-common.conf.
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE.
- Update hacking to current version

Change-Id: I130f1a45151dd45426b99869f40b54361278b5c7

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I29f0c4b67096dcf089537fa9282ec568f69da66a

Cleanup repo a bit

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I626737549ce3aeff0eeef63c42e6330d70192a63

added_lines: # Copyright 2018 FUJITSU LIMITED # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import falcon from monasca_events_api.app.common import helpers from monasca_events_api.app.controller.v1 import body_validation from monasca_events_api.app.controller.v1 import bulk_processor from monasca_events_api.app.core.model import prepare_message_to_sent from oslo_log import log LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class Events(object): """Events. Events acts as a RESTful endpoint accepting messages contains collected events from the OpenStack message bus. Works as getaway for any further processing for accepted data. """ VERSION = 'v1.0' SUPPORTED_CONTENT_TYPES = {'application/json'} def __init__(self): super(Events, self).__init__() self._processor = bulk_processor.EventsBulkProcessor() def on_post(self, req, res): """Accepts sent events as json. Accepts events sent to resource which should be sent to Kafka queue. :param req: current request :param res: current response """ policy_action = 'events_api:agent_required' try: req.validate(self.SUPPORTED_CONTENT_TYPES) request_body = helpers.read_json_msg_body(req) req.can(policy_action) project_id = req.project_id body_validation.validate_body(request_body) messages = prepare_message_to_sent(request_body) self._processor.send_message(messages, event_project_id=project_id) res.status = falcon.HTTP_200 except falcon.HTTPUnprocessableEntity as ex: LOG.error('Entire bulk package was rejected, unsupported body') LOG.exception(ex) raise ex except falcon.HTTPUnsupportedMediaType as ex: LOG.error('Entire bulk package was rejected, ' 'unsupported media type') LOG.exception(ex) raise ex except Exception as ex: LOG.error('Entire bulk package was rejected') LOG.exception(ex) _title = ex.title if hasattr(ex, 'title') else None _descr = ex.description if hasattr(ex, 'description') else None raise falcon.HTTPError(falcon.HTTP_400, title=_title, description=_descr) @property def version(self): return getattr(self, 'VERSION')

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I837241a34505496a3a152d72f28f23687ded1088

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I46b98c7a61f2e19b68eee521c9c71971b0df9ad8

commit_message:
[hca] Join threads before closing file descriptor

In some environments, heat container agent is erroring because of file
descriptor closing before threads have joined.

Change-Id: I1de5042ea5f4229518e96b985b1832dcacb052db
Story: 2007264
Task: 39788

commit_message:
Remove empty default LVM configuration

Since this configuration uses the overlay storage driver, it doesn't
require the LVM data volume group, previously we set the list of VGs to
empty.

Kayobe in Ussuri is modifying the default configuration such that the
VG list will be empty by default unless using the devicemapper driver.

This change removes the VG configuration override.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/722316

Change-Id: I0ebe05baa67ea71b3df77f2e7f7870a237e4cb23
Story: 2005667
Task: 39537

commit_message:
Configure ansible forks based on cores

At present we use a fixed value of 36. It seems the emperical
formula is 4 forks per core ans would be automatically limited
by ansible to the number of hosts.

Change-Id: I9a9e600935e3b8443341a1dc28421a19d9978bfe
(cherry picked from commit ce948ae04947596afe2e1acefaca0a7813f1268f)

commit_message:
Fix bifrost_inventory.py with no nodes enrolled

Run the bifrost_inventory.py script withBIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic,
and no hosts enrolled in ironic. It fails:

    RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

This change fixes the issue by using a copy of the groups dictionary.

Change-Id: I614580c37406a75eab356fdc217a3ffa052bc5ff
Story: 2007776
Task: 40002
(cherry picked from commit 3ffa9c78376f75acc418590489125a8ba0769ab0)

commit_message:
New extension call to return partition UUIDs

Currently we parse the success message from the write_image call.
This is inconvenient and incompatible with the deploy steps split.

Change-Id: I258dc1ff1ad1c9df5cbc26a7825d9e7ef2f3205b
Story: #2006963

commit_message:
devstack: increase concurrency and worker timeout for sushy-tools

Sometimes sushy-tools hits worker timeout in gunicorn when handing
a virtual media ISO, causing a request to be aborted and deployment
to fail. Increase the timeout from 30 to 90 seconds and add some
concurrency to ensure that more than one deployment can run.

Change-Id: I9e951aaaa13981602151bff3f2eebfa338113f6c

commit_message:
Make the install_bootloader command asynchronous

It does not return anything, so it makes no point for it to be
synchronous. Ironic always calls it with wait=True, so there is
no problem with backward compatibility either.

Change-Id: I44fec2e0cb54486328ce71263613d8592e384870

subject: Fix test_barbican_legacy for Python 3.8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-29 15:14:24.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/certificates/manager/test_barbican_legacy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/a84bf7d84381b5781a9c4b8764f7bf7bb8ef73ae', 'message': "Fix test_barbican_legacy for Python 3.8

Fixes failing unit tests in
octavia.tests.unit.certificates.manager.test_barbican_legacy.TestBarbicanManager
for Python 3.8

Some of the tests fail setting up a mock.Mock(spec=secrets.Secret)
because a ValueError exception is raised unexpectedly.

The reason is that test_get_cert_no_registration_raise_on_secret_access_failure
patches the `payload` property of barbicanclient.v1.secrets.Secret to
raise a ValueError.
When a subsequent test tries to set up a mock.Mock(spec=secrets.Secret)
in Python 3.8 the Mock class will try to look at the properties of the spec
class and accessing `payload` doesn't behave normally anymore: it raises
ValueError now.

Fixed by using a different approach of mocking `payload` in
test_get_cert_no_registration_raise_on_secret_access_failure
so that it does not influence subsequent tests.

Change-Id: Ic534a4715c85c2216c7251209507acf74a999153
Story: 2007490
Task: 39212
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_barbican_legacy for Python 3.8

Fixes failing unit tests in
octavia.tests.unit.certificates.manager.test_barbican_legacy.TestBarbicanManager
for Python 3.8

Some of the tests fail setting up a mock.Mock(spec=secrets.Secret)
because a ValueError exception is raised unexpectedly.

The reason is that test_get_cert_no_registration_raise_on_secret_access_failure
patches the `payload` property of barbicanclient.v1.secrets.Secret to
raise a ValueError.
When a subsequent test tries to set up a mock.Mock(spec=secrets.Secret)
in Python 3.8 the Mock class will try to look at the properties of the spec
class and accessing `payload` doesn't behave normally anymore: it raises
ValueError now.

Fixed by using a different approach of mocking `payload` in
test_get_cert_no_registration_raise_on_secret_access_failure
so that it does not influence subsequent tests.

Change-Id: Ic534a4715c85c2216c7251209507acf74a999153
Story: 2007490
Task: 39212

Change-Id: I3a60512383c24fb54aeba354c991e5decf479d15

commit_message:
Add dynamic-portgroups spec for NGS

Change-Id: I3a60512383c24fb54aeba354c991e5decf479d15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch refs/changes/38/561138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================== Dynamic port groups =================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-generic-switch/+bug/1752479 In the Ocata release, Ironic added support for grouping ports into port groups. The administrator also has the ability to specify ``mode`` and ``properties`` of a port group by using appropriate port group fields. However the administrator is still required to pre-create a port group on the ToR (Top of Rack) switch manually. Or find some other way to sync portgroup settings between Ironic and the ML2 driver. Problem description =================== While Ironic provides the ability to create port groups with different configurations (mode and properties), port groups still have to be pre-created on ToR manually as we do not pass port group details to ML2 drivers. To make port groups creation ``dynamic`` Ironic should pass port group settings to Neutron ML2 drivers. The ML2 driver is responsible for port group configuration (creation/deletion) on ToR switch during deployment. Proposed change =============== Start passing port group information to Neutron ML2 drivers via the Neutron port ``binding:profile`` field. Appropriate Neutron ML2 drivers will use that information to create port group dynamically on the ToR switch. If local_group_information is not None, we will create link aggregation group at switch and bind switch interface to link aggregation group name according to port group settings For Huawei as a example: add the parameter Eth-Trunk in "property", which means port group id when creating a port group. f you are using huawei vrpv8 switch and ironic port group, you can use the command as follow. openstack --os-baremetal-api-version 1.26 baremetal port group create \ --node $NODE_UUID --name test --address fa:ab:25:48:fd:ba --mode 802.3ad \ --property miimon=100 --property link-aggregation-group="50" \ --support-standalone-ports Huawei driver should map link-aggregation mode 802.3ad and link-aggregation-group name 50 to switch configuration. Binding profile data structure ------------------------------ * Introduce new ``local_group_information`` dictionary that stores portgroups information. * Reuse existing ``local_link_information`` for port objects only A JSON example of ``binding:profile`` with ``local_link_information`` reuse: :: "binding:profile": { 'local_link_information': [ { 'switch_info': 'tor-switch0', 'port_id': 'Gig0/1' 'switch_id': 'aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff' }, { 'switch_info': 'tor-switch0', 'port_id': 'Gig0/2', 'switch_id': 'aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff' } ], 'local_group_information': { 'id': '51a9642b-1414-4bd6-9a92-1320ddc55a63', 'name': 'PortGroup0', 'bond_mode': 'active-backup', 'bond_properties': { 'bond_xmit_hash_policy': 'layer3+4', 'bond_miimon': 100, } }, } The data types: +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ | Field Name | Description | +=======================+===================================================+ | id | The UUID of Ironic portgroup object | +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ | name | The name of the ironic port group | +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ | bond_mode | Ironic portgroup mode | +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ | bond_properties | Ironic portgroup properties | +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ | switch_info | The hostname of the switch | +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ | port_id | The identifier of the port on the switch | +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ | switch_id | The identifier of the switch, ie mac address | +-----------------------+---------------------------------------------------+ .. note:: It is recommended to pick ``bond_mode`` and keys/values for ``bond_properties`` from the [1]_ as they will be used by user OS. Alternatives ------------ * Use port groups in the static fashion when administrator pre-creates port group on ToR switch. * If ML2 driver supports port group creation, make sure that port group properties in Ironic and ML2 are the same. Data model impact ----------------- None. State Machine Impact -------------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None. RPC API impact -------------- None. Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ None. Ramdisk impact -------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- No need to pre-create port group at the ToR switch. Only need to specify port group configuration at the Ironic portgroup object. Developer impact ---------------- Out of tree network interfaces should be updated to pass ``portgroup.mode`` and ``portgroup.properties`` with ``links`` array in Neutron port ``binding:profile`` field. Vendors are responsible to deal with ``links`` to support dynamic port groups. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Zachary Ma <mazengxie@126.com> Work Items ---------- * Add dynamic port group support to networking-generic-switch Dependencies ============ Dynamic portgroup support is dependent on Neutron ML2 driver functionality being developed to deal with ``links`` array in ``binding:profile`` field. Testing ======= * Add dynamic port group support to networking-generic-switch * Update tempest with appropriate tests. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== Backward compatibility is retained as Ironic will still pass ``local_link_information`` in Neutron port ``binding:profile`` field. Documentation Impact ==================== This feature will be fully documented. References ========== .. [1] *Linux kernel bond*: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/bonding.txt

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Idbbcf7dadd3019dd79e50aace55f308cde1eed2e

commit_message:
Fix multiple issues

Both issues affect Train and earlier releases.

1. Fix monasca-grafana by pinning more Ruby gems

childprocess 3.0.0 and ffi 1.13.0 depend on Ruby 2.3.

2. Bump bifrost to 6.0.4

Bifrost had a fix to stop using the master branch of DIB which dropped
support for Python 2.

3. Drop docker-client from OracleLinux sensu-client image

The package fails to install due to a missing dependency on
subscription-manager.

Change-Id: Ida7e20833360bbca69c6aafc4f5d7cb375bb106f
Closes-Bug: #1882070
(cherry picked from commit 3784d32d9ceacf0dad8057092752f1ae7be37ed3)

removal of controllers.

added_lines: Filtering responsibilities between API and driversv3 identity API. By default these queries are satisfied in the HTTP method of resource class when it calls the ``wrap_collection`` method at the end of a ``get`` method. However, to enable optimum performance, any driverThe communication of the filter details between resource class and its drivers is handled by the passing of a reference to a Hints object, which is a list of dicts describing the filters. A driver that satisfies a filter must delete the filter from the Hints object so that when it is returned to the HTTP method of resource, it knows to only execute any unsatisfied filters. The contract for a driver for ``get`` method is therefore:
deleted_lines: Filtering responsibilities between controllers and driversv3 identity API. By default these queries are satisfied in the controller class when a controller calls the ``wrap_collection`` method at the end of a ``list_{entity}`` method. However, to enable optimum performance, any driverThe communication of the filter details between the controller level and its drivers is handled by the passing of a reference to a Hints object, which is a list of dicts describing the filters. A driver that satisfies a filter must delete the filter from the Hints object so that when it is returned to the controller level, it knows to only execute any unsatisfied filters. The contract for a driver for ``list_{entity}`` methods is therefore:

commit_message:
Fix bifrost_inventory.py with no nodes enrolled

Run the bifrost_inventory.py script withBIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic,
and no hosts enrolled in ironic. It fails:

    RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

This change fixes the issue by using a copy of the groups dictionary.

Change-Id: I614580c37406a75eab356fdc217a3ffa052bc5ff
Story: 2007776
Task: 40002

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

subject: [WIP] Enable virtualBMC testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-03 11:02:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic/commit/271ce0bd5cb213fbb9633da09ed56abe9833f2f7', 'message': "Adjust networking for flat network to work

Although we aren't using the flat networking yet - the plan to integrate
virtual bmc will require the flat networking to work properly. In light
of the changes made to the tempest and nova roles to get this working,
this PR makes the same changes here.

Change-Id: I7b5446b28b5d721437ad7d3f7adfcfa63dcfcad9
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-04 14:16:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic/commit/14f0426c739bc3f4a2264134b2e63b6c770d1155', 'message': '[WIP] Enable virtualBMC testing

This PR adds virtual hardware testing for Ironic, so that we can have a
more realistic test infrastructure.

This PR does the following (so far, this is a WIP):
* Fix the flat networking
* Add a vlan provisioning network for Ironic
* Remove unrequired nova roles from the inventory

* Remove unrequired nova roles from the inventory

* TBD

linuxbridge as an intial step, potentially adding OVS after.

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable virtualBMC testing

This PR adds virtual hardware testing for Ironic, so that we can have a
more realistic test infrastructure.

This PR does the following (so far, this is a WIP):
* Fix the flat networking
* Add a provisioning network for Ironic
* Add an IPMI network for Ironic
* Remove unrequired nova roles from the inventory
* Add tempest - which will setup the flat network appropriately.
* Setup the required pip/apt packages
* Setup the virsh net/pool/volume/instance
* Add neutron network settings
* Add pxe_ipmitool driver
* Configure Ironic provisioning/cleanup networks
* Allow network name to be specified for cleaning/provisioning network
* Setup flavor
* Add images
* Enroll node
* Added required packages for libvirt/qemu to work

TODO:
* Fix console log
* Fix the whole thing

This implementation will be based on the devstack implementation of
virtualBMC within the Ironic role itself. However we aim to utilize
linuxbridge as an intial step, potentially adding OVS after.

Change-Id: I7b5446b28b5d721437ad7d3f7adfcfa63dcfcad9

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Iff823437b09ca2905b52271acce63d849f62bc89

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Idce1f2a4d88ccdf96d40b7adc6bbfcd575afbc15

commit_message:
Repair the support for building IPA images with DIB

1) install PyYAML with dependencies

   DIB does not play well with virtual environments created with
   the native Python venv module. Installing PyYAML globally helps
   it to go past the points where it breaks out of the venv.

2) Switch to Debian Buster since Stretch only has Python 3.5

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/734414/
Change-Id: Ie0e083a7379f88be2c5bdf416f0dbfd02a4c8731
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/86/731186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I1ee45007d9d4e477d7326e93dff62ca17b217789

commit_message:
[doc] Extend trouble shooting docs for node stuck in wait states

Change-Id: Ic16ea14ebc984c4a465dc759984b42d0785dc7f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/55/733655/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Why are my nodes stuck in a "wait" state? ========================================= The Ironic conductor uses states containing ``wait`` as a signifier that the conductor is waiting for a callback from another component, such as the Ironic Python Agent or the Inspector. If this feedback does not arrive, the conductor will time out and the node will eventually move to a ``failed`` state. Depending on the configuration and the circumstances, however, a node can stay in a ``wait`` state for a long time or even never time out. The list of such wait states includes: * ``clean wait`` for cleaning, * ``inspect wait`` for introspection, * ``rescue wait`` for rescueing, and * ``wait-callback`` for deploying. Communication issues between the conductor and the node ------------------------------------------------------- One of the most common issues when nodes seem to be stuck in a wait state occur when the node never received any instructions or does not react as expected: the conductor moved the node to a wait state but the node will never call back. Examples include wrong ciphers which will make ipmitool get stuck or BMCs in a state where they accept commands, but don't do the requested task (or only a part of it, like shutting off, but not starting). It is useful in these cases to see via a ping or the console if and which action the node is performing. If the node does not seem to react to the requests sent be the conductor, it may be worthwhile to try the corresponding action out-of-band, e.g. confirm that power on/off commands work when directly sent to the BMC. The section on `IPMI errors`_. above gives some additional points to check. In some situations, a BMC reset may be necessary. Ironic Python Agent stuck ------------------------- Nodes can also get remain in a wait state when the component the conductor is waiting for gets stuck, e.g. when a hardware manager enters a loop or is waiting for an event that is never happening. In these cases, it might be helpful to connect to the IPA and inspect its logs, see the trouble shooting guide of the :ironic-python-agent-doc:`ironic-python-agent (IPA) <>` on how to do this.

commit_message:
image_convert: retry resource unavailable and make RLIMIT configurable

This change fixes two potential issues with qemu-img on a busy machine:
1) Retry infrequent "Resource temporarily unavailable"
2) Make address space limits configurable instead of hardcoding to 1Gi

Story: #2007644
Task: #39702
Change-Id: I82a94e68e1aa1f634c7f0877ccd674574d1c9bb0
(cherry picked from commit 555c4948dc271ab882525d030303b3eca83585dd)

added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('image_convert_memory_limit', default=1024, help='Memory limit for "qemu-img convert" in MiB. Implemented ' 'via the address space resource limit.'), cfg.IntOpt('image_convert_attempts', default=3, help='Number of attempts to convert an image.'),QEMU_IMG_LIMITS = None def _qemu_img_limits(): global QEMU_IMG_LIMITS if QEMU_IMG_LIMITS is None: QEMU_IMG_LIMITS = processutils.ProcessLimits( address_space=CONF.disk_utils.image_convert_memory_limit * units.Mi) return QEMU_IMG_LIMITS prlimit=_qemu_img_limits()) # TODO(dtantsur): use the retrying library for attempt in range(CONF.disk_utils.image_convert_attempts): cmd = ('qemu-img', 'convert', '-O', out_format, source, dest) try: utils.execute(*cmd, run_as_root=run_as_root, prlimit=_qemu_img_limits(), use_standard_locale=True) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as e: if ('Resource temporarily unavailable' in e.stderr and attempt < CONF.disk_utils.image_convert_attempts - 1): LOG.debug('Failed to convert image, retrying. Error: %s', e) # Sync disk caches before the next attempt utils.execute('sync') else: raise else: return

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Use doc/requirements for doc requirements following PTI.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I1c0aeb590b1ce0f5ee43f9bcea51eeef1c98f057

commit_message:
Debuntu: add apt-transport-https

I don't see anywhere we bring this in, especially on a minimal build.
In 2020 it seems like a base dependency, put it alongside
software-properties-common that installs the other apt helper bits.

Change-Id: I5b079eac4912cb4a164e9aa6158ed106a28f576c

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I66e7ccc9329108de987a0b39ff46e5f3d74efa07

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ibd72ce6104d42c348e2e1340cb8b4f4f5c724af4

commit_message:
Do not fail in a venv when activate_this.py is not found

The standard Python venv module does not have this script, so currently
DIB unconditionally fails. While a real fix will be provided in
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704478/ this change at least allows
users to try work around the problem.

Change-Id: I45b79d4d283f2b3ea909612e652672dcb6092488

commit_message:
Remove congress project team

Congress did not have any PTL candidate at the recent Victoria PTL election,
the project being peripheral projects with no other project depending on them,
the TC decided to remove their deliverables from the Victoria release.

Since they no longer produce a deliverable included in the OpenStack
release, the Congress team is no longer official OpenStack project teams.

The project stays on the Opendev infrastructure and can continue to
be developed and maintained in x namespace if necessary.

Should a sustainable team form around them, the TC will consider adding them
back to the OpenStack release and make them official again.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/721742
Change-Id: If49d6fd0ad3413d0c478900108dd055dbaaaa8b3

commit_message:
Enable glance cache prefetcher interval

As new periodic job added in glance which will run as per
interval set using 'cache_prefetcher_interval' configuration
option and fetch images which are queued for caching in cache
directory.

Added GlanceImagePrefetcherInterval to configure
'cache_prefetcher_interval' configuration option
in glance-api.conf when glance cache is enabled.

Depends-on: I8ece28a9b0c6f104130d817490e9ea4c2b4e7808
Change-Id: I5294f7b9984ef0b59f505819e2ce95c41e69d3c8
(cherry picked from commit 13b06b52488e94ee3845c59c012144117dcf8140)

commit_message:

- Reactive charms: trigger a rebuild

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I54a2fde199c151eee0ca81c0db840609088803ac

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I5651bc099e70a5345b44d87e76a607ff11f0d34a

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document

* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org

"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ic436b800e4474a0e45703231f8138ad97505335b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar-specs refs/changes/43/731943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6709d09657c61c1c37736c4162942f8c587ceae8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-dashboard refs/changes/63/722363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-21 18:18:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/requirements.txt', 'releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/blazar-dashboard/commit/d249b802beba82594b0b8e5b1cca3a282577ea29', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I882ab18020ee8a15a3204e72d1bf68f4d5195b14
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I882ab18020ee8a15a3204e72d1bf68f4d5195b14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar-dashboard refs/changes/87/730087/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I524d5c8b09b31dbc6781792d5dc91994f7ed4791

commit_message:
[doc] Check placement in case of "No valid host found"

Change-Id: I0fa1f604a06b67e90d16443d7e27a37a3299229a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/85/733485/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Upon scheduling, Nova will query the Placement API service for the available resource providers (in the case of Ironic: nodes with a given resource class). If placement does not have any allocation candidates for the requested resource class, the request will result in a "Nova valid host was found" error. It is hence sensible to check if Placement is aware of resource providers (nodes) for the requested resource class with:: $ openstack allocation candidate list --resource CUSTOM_BAREMETAL_LARGE='1' +---+-----------------------------+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+ | # | allocation | resource provider | inventory used/capacity | +---+-----------------------------+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+ | 1 | CUSTOM_BAREMETAL_LARGE=1 | 2f7b9c69-c1df-4e40-b94e-5821a4ea0453 | CUSTOM_BAREMETAL_LARGE=0/1 | +---+-----------------------------+--------------------------------------+-------------------------------+ For Ironic, the resource provider is the UUID of the available Ironic node. If this command returns an empty list (or does not contain the targeted resource provider), the operator needs to understand first, why the resource tracker has not reported this provider to placement. Potential explanations include: * the resource tracker cycle has not finished yet and the resource provider will appear once it has (the time to finish the cycle scales linearly with the number of nodes the corresponding ``nova-compute`` service manages); * the node is in a state where the resource tracker does not consider it to be eligible for scheduling, e.g. when the node has ``maintenance`` set to ``True``; make sure the target nodes are in ``available`` and ``maintenance`` is ``False``;

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Id3007be0973e7da345aa9b02c6abde25a373180f

commit_message:
Fix os-keypairs pagination links

The API URL is '/os-keypairs', not '/keypairs'. Attempting to use these
pagination links as-is will result in a HTTP 404 (Not Found).

Change-Id: Ic04568caecc138e6016418f6878d031c4a0d3fb4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1866373
(cherry picked from commit f31efe0a0e3f194ca415ac41c225f63dbb69267b)
(cherry picked from commit 93f903d7949194a3e00647d8a17b2d3bee3904e5)

commit_message:
[Ussuri only] Fix for CentOS8 containers build

Tripleo centos-8 ussuri container bulid job is failing in rdo ci [1]
because of disabling epel repos in openstack/kolla stable/ussuri [2].

Remove 'epel' and 'epel-modular' from repo disable list as
we remove epel-release via base_centos_yum_repo_packages_remove.

Note: This patch is only ussuri specific,
as kolla do not have epel related change in master.

Here is the testproject patch to test
this changes: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/27963/

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/builds?job_name=periodic-tripleo-centos-8-ussuri-containers-build-push&pipeline=openstack-periodic-latest-released
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731798/

Closes-Bug: #1882246
Change-Id: Icdea9086970576a9178b51399054e0f888808064

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2728250b2646af93c65ac7f18dbf7600fe5a286c

subject: resize: Send only nodes_to_remove and node_count
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-26 15:57:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/5966accefeb6ff9245f6319dcda6b9ccede300c2', 'message': 'resize: Send only nodes_to_remove and node_count

When resizing a NG we should strictly send the
desired node_count and the nodes_to_remove.
Otherwise the stack update operation may replace/rebuild
nodes or other resources.

This was the functionality with:
Id84e5d878b21c908021e631514c2c58b3fe8b8b0
But it was reverted with:
I725413e77f5a7bdb48131e8a10e5dc884b5e066a

Story: 2005266
task: 39860

commit_message:
resize: Send only nodes_to_remove and node_count

When resizing a NG we should strictly send the
desired node_count and the nodes_to_remove.
Otherwise the stack update operation may replace/rebuild
nodes or other resources.

This was the functionality with:
Id84e5d878b21c908021e631514c2c58b3fe8b8b0
But it was reverted with:
I725413e77f5a7bdb48131e8a10e5dc884b5e066a

Story: 2005266
task: 39860

Change-Id: Ib31b6801e0e2d954c31ac91e77ae9d3ef1afebd2
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

The repo is setup in project-config to use storyboard, so update the
config.

Change-Id: I1ba7f47312fea8de36c4c0c0ca6bf9c2220cbf42

commit_message:
Add daemonize library

The daemonize library is still used by molteniron.

It's in a good state, but not maintained since roughly 1 year.
It's Python 3 compatible, officially up to Python 3.5.
It's released under MIT License, so license compatible.
It's already packaged in the distros we target.



Change-Id: I0c339b4202299521468ef657a3a3de9a68b9cd09

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Icc4368708d2f1a11cb976789d8e06496b231302e

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-30 14:49:54.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/requirements.txt', 'releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/freezer-tempest-plugin/commit/e4b0b9377e569ad842c1bc79df7a0f1e9bd3ac4b', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using

* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used

not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
